clinical_study.brief_title: Interfaces of Non-invasive Ventilation on Performance in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Various Interfaces of Non-invasive Ventilation on Performance During Exercise in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine wether the interface (facial or nasal mask) influences performance in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exercising with non-invasive ventilation.

primary_outcome.measure: Endurance time (Tlim, in second) during Constant Work Load Test (CWLT).
primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure after every CWLT. The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.
primary_outcome.description: Patients will achieve 3 Constant Work Load Test Under different conditions (1 without noninvasive ventilation and 2 with noninvasive ventilation using in a randomised order facial or nasal mask). Endurance time (sec) will be recorded at the end of every test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comfort of different masks using numerical scale (0-10) after exercising with noninvasive ventilation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure after every CWLT achieved with noninvasive ventilation. CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.
secondary_outcome.description: The comfort of the different interfaces is assessed after every CWLT using numerical scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dyspnea during CWLT using modified Borg Scale (0-10).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during every CWLT.The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum. Data will be collected every 30s during tests.
secondary_outcome.description: The dyspnea will be assessed every 30sec during CWLT. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 3 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Exhaustion during CWLT using modified Borg Scale (0-10).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during every CWLT.The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum. Data will be collected every 30s during tests.
secondary_outcome.description: The exhaustion will be assessed every 30sec during CWLT. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 3 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate (rpm) during CWLT using capnograph.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during every CWLT (with or without noninvasive ventilation).The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum. Data will be continuously collected.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 3 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure (mmHg) before and after every CWLT using electrical blood pressure device.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed before and after every CWLT. The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen saturation (SpO2, %) during CWLT using capnograph.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during every CWLT (with or without noninvasive ventilation).The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum. Data will be continuously collected.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 3 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Transcutaneous carbon dioxide pressure (PtcCO2, mmHg) during CWLT using capnograph.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during every CWLT (with or without noninvasive ventilation).The 3 CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum. Data will be continuously collected.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 3 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory rate (rpm) during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation using ventilator monitoring.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation. CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 2 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Inspiratory tidal volume (Vti, in liter) during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation using ventilator monitoring.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation. CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 2 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Leak (liter per minute) during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation using ventilator monitoring.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation. CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome will be continuously recorded. Results will be shown at Tlim (Tlim for the 2 tests) and iso time (defined as the Tlim or the shortest test).

other_outcome.measure: Ventilatory asynchronism during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation using ventilator monitoring.
other_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be measure during CWLT with noninvasive ventilation. CWLT will be carried out in different days, separate from 1 day minimum for a total time frame of 2 weeks maximum.

arm_group.description: This study has a cross-over design. Patients will achieve CWLT with non-invasive ventilation using facial or nasal mask in a randomised order.
This study has a cross-over design. Patients will achieve CWLT with non-invasive ventilation using facial or nasal mask in a randomised order.

intervention.intervention_name: Non invasive ventilation during exercise with facial or nasal mask.
intervention.description: Every patients will achieve 3 constant work load test (CWLT) at 75% Wpic. The first CWLT will be realized without any ventilatory support. The 2 others CWLT will be achieved with non-invasive ventilation support using facial or nasal interface in a randomized order.
